body_html: @vrv The Udacity course is nonlinear and doesn't have a rich, drill-down vocabulary that is required for pedogogical purposes. Thus, it doesn't, by itself, suffice for the purposes of providing documentation for Tensorflow. The theory that is presented is half-baked and too abstract to convert to code from some high-level graphics.

body: @vrv The Udacity course is nonlinear and doesn't have a rich, drill-down vocabulary that is required for pedogogical purposes.  Thus, it doesn't, by itself, suffice for the purposes of providing documentation for Tensorflow.  The theory that is presented is half-baked and too abstract to convert to code from some high-level graphics.
